content: @Laryn @StPaulTim I got a RFP for a project to create a site very much like https://catholicsmobilizing.org, with a conference section
@Laryn https://catholicsmobilizing.org/conference/schedule is beautiful, and I used it as an example -- the client LOVED it, so thank you :)
...and may I say: excelent use of an info type of message on that page :wink:
Oh, great! (And thanks).
Periodically I am kicking around how much work it would be to package a module that creates a content type, fields, layout, etc. and makes a "conference site in a box".

Laryn said:

Periodically I am kicking around how much work it would be to package a module that creates a content type, fields, layout, etc. and makes a "conference site in a box".

https://www.drupal.org/project/cod
Seems like a good candidate to suck into Backdrop land!
We've talked about COD, however I think that there are good reasons to build a new version of COD.
I think we'd make some different choices.
We don’t have to take any bits of its architecture that we don’t want to; my main interest is that it proves the market.
Never heard of it -- what are the reasons/choices?

jenlampton said:

Laryn https://catholicsmobilizing.org/conference/schedule is beautiful, and I used it as an example -- the client LOVED it, so thank you :)

@Laryn , I'm going to want to steal that view at some point.

In talks with @jenlampton about a possible conference distribution for Backdrop CMS. Looking for feedback and anyone interested in helping out.

1) I'd like to move this to https://github.com/backdrop-contrib - once I sort out the name. Ideas.
https://github.com/TeamTriplo/backdrop_events/issues/2

2) Also looking for feedback on whether or not a distribution is the right model for this set of features.
https://github.com/TeamTriplo/backdrop_events/issues/3

Backdrop CMS contributed projects
Join the group at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib to add your own! - Backdrop CMS contributed projects
Decide on a title for this project · Issue #2 · TeamTriplo/backdrop_events
What do we want to call this. Tentative starting name is "Backdrop Events," but I think we can do better. Events distribution Events profile Conference package Conference kit Event in a box
Decide how to package this - Distribution, profile, or recipe? · Issue #3 · TeamTriplo/backdrop_events
I'm starting out thinking that this is an experimental distribution. Part of the goal for this project (in my mind) is to test the idea of distributions in the Backdrop world. As of this moment...
I like it.
If I move this to project to backdrop-config - will I be able to change the project name later?
You mean backdrop-contrib?
Does this help at all?: https://docs.github.com/en/free-pro-team@latest/github/administering-a-repository/renaming-a-repository
Yes :-) and Yes

OK, lacking feedback on a better name (and growing used to "Backdrop Events"), I went ahead and moved this repo to backdrop-contrib. https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_events

backdrop-contrib/backdrop_events
A distribution for event sites using Backdrop CMS. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/backdrop_events development by creating an account on GitHub.
All of a sudden I’m brainstorming names :)
Me too!
I think 'Events Site' (since it has nothing to do with Backdrop itself, and it create a full site (as opposed to functionality you add to an existing site)).

We have an issue for that: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/backdrop_events/issues/2

Decide on a title for this project · Issue #2 · backdrop-contrib/backdrop_events
What do we want to call this. Tentative starting name is "Backdrop Events," but I think we can do better. Events distribution Events profile Conference package Conference kit Event in a box

I like the idea of a name that sounds like it will take a lot of the work out it it:

  • Instant
  • quick
  • pop-up
  • ready
  • ramen
  • easy
  • turnkey
  • pre-made
  • pre-fab
  • in a box
"2-minute events" :smiling_face:
I always have concerns about promising too much. "Instant Events" sounds good, but it's also promising a lot.
Sounds to me like a brand of oatmeal.
"Just add dates!" :laughter_tears:
"ramen"?
I like a name that says exactly what it does. Like "Events Distribution"
Taken literally, that sounds like something that distributes events — one for you, and one for you, and one for you...
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) Ramen is cheap, easy, quick, and everybody loves it :)
That might be, but that is not what comes to mind when I think of ramen. All I think of is noodles.

The downside of a distribution, I suppose, is that you can't add it on to an existing site as easily. The most recent conference site I've been helping with added the conference functionality into the main site and used a separate layout instance (and adjusting the header, menu, etc.) for a new "conference" content type to make it feel like a sub-site even though it is part of the main site.
What about shortening the Distribution to Distro.... "Events Distro"
